intro: Eriogonum hoffmannii, commonly known as Hoffmann’s buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Eriogonum hoffmannii plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in chaparral and woodland ecosystems.
